channel.title: Anyone try the axopatcher on raspberry pi2/3 running 64bit open suse?

item.title: Anyone try the axopatcher on raspberry pi2/3 running 64bit open suse?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

PI lacks the CPU/GPU needed (currently) by the patcher.

A few topics on this eg

Is anyone using the patcher software on a raspberry pi 3?

this has come up a few times before, and a specific topic here ... my gut feeling was no, it not going to work well anyway, I decided, really the only way to know 100% was to 'suck it and see' so, I just installed axoloti on my Raspberry PI2 with a Linaro distribution. (the linaro distro, is pretty good performance as Ive tried it on other things, PI2 as I don't have a PI3) so , it took a bit of hacking of the build script for linux, and determining where to source packages…

I've recently tested on a tinker board and that is close, but still not quite there. ( bit more powerful than pi3)

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone try the axopatcher on raspberry pi2/3 running 64bit open suse?

item.title: Anyone try the axopatcher on raspberry pi2/3 running 64bit open suse?
item.dc:creator: @flybry1405
item.description:
@flybry1405 wrote:

www.linux.com

First 64-Bit and Enterprise OS Comes to Raspberry P...

SUSE supports a lot of architectures and runs on everything from IBM mainframe to x86 machines, and more. With ARM’s push in the data center, it made even more sense for SUSE to work closely with ARM to support yet another platform.

Anyone try this yet?

Read full topic
